trans-unit.source: Contains information about a part of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> at a specified coordinate.
This class cannot be inherited.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo> class, in conjunction with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control, is used to determine which part of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control the user has clicked.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo> class contains the row, column, and part of the grid that was clicked.
See the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestType> enumeration returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo.Type%2A> property for a complete list of grid parts.

To return a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo>, invoke the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseDown> event of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid> control.
Pass the `x` and `y` properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs> to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTest%2A> method.
Gets the number of the column the user has clicked.
If the coordinate is not a cell, the property returns -1.
The number of the column.
Indicates whether two objects are identical.
The second object to compare, typed as <xref href="System.Object"></xref>.
`true` if the objects are equal; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the hash code for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo"></xref> instance.
This method overrides <xref:System.Object.GetHashCode%2A>.
The hash code for this instance.
Indicates that a coordinate corresponds to part of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> control that is not functioning.
Other parts of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid?displayProperty=fullName>, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestType.Caption>, can return useful information.
If the part of the grid has no function (such as the gray area behind a sparsely populated grid table), the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo.Nowhere> field is returned.
Gets the number of the row the user has clicked.
If the coordinate is not a cell, the property returns -1.

If the coordinate is a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestType.RowHeader>, the property returns the row number of the header, but the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestInfo.Column%2A> property will return -1.
The number of the clicked row.
Gets the type, row number, and column number.
The type, row number, and column number.
Gets the part of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid"></xref> control, other than the row or column, that was clicked.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGrid.HitTestType"></xref> enumerations.
